info.title: ReversingLabs Intelligence
info.description: ReversingLabs continually processes goodware and malware files providing early intelligence about attacks before they infiltrate customer infrastructures. This visibility to threats “in-the-wild” enables preparation for new attacks and quickly identifies the threat levels of new files as they arrive. ReversingLabs enables more effective and efficient threat identification, development of better threat intelligence, and implementation of proactive threat hunting programs.

get.description: This service provides information about the malware status of requested files.

parameters.name: hash_type
parameters.description: required parameter; accepts these options: md5, sha1, sha256

parameters.name: hash_value
parameters.description: required parameter; must be a valid hash of the type defined by hash_type

parameters.name: show_hashes
parameters.description: Both single and bulk malware presence queries support an additional request parameter show\_hashes which can be either true or false. The parameter show\_hashes can also be used with the Extended Malware Presence query. If not specified, the default value is false. When set to true, the show_hashes parameter will direct databrowser to provide md5, sha1 and sha256 hashes for the requested file(s), in addition to the rest of the Malware Presence information.

parameters.name: extended
parameters.description: Both single and bulk malware presence queries support an additional query flag extended which can be either true or false. If not specified, the default value is false. When set to true, the extended flag will direct databrowser to provide a richer response schema with additional information about the requested file(s).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Optional parameter that allows choosing the response format. Supported values are `xml` and `json`. If the parameter is not provided in the request, the response will be returned in `xml` (default).

400.description: Bad Request! The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. A possible reason might be that the request contains Unicode characters that cannot be processed.

401.description: Unauthorized! The request requires user authentication. The request MUST include a WWW- Authenticate header field containing a challenge applicable to the requested resource.

403.description: Forbidden! The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

404.description: Not Found! The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.

500.description: Internal Server Error! The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Service Unavailable! The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

get.summary: Get Functionally Similar File Hashes Using ReversingLabs Hash Algorithm
get.description: This service provides a list of SHA1 hashes of files that are functionally similar to the provided file (SHA1 hash) at the selected precision level.

parameters.name: rha1_type
parameters.description: rha1_type is a measure of the RHA1 precision level. It represents the degree to which a file is functionally similar to another file. A higher Precision Level will match fewer files but the files will have more functional similarity: - pe01, elf01, machO01 - 25% precision level - pe02 - 50% precision level

parameters.name: hash_value
parameters.description: required parameter; must be a valid SHA1 value

parameters.name: next_page_sha1
parameters.description: next_page_sha1 is an optional parameter used for pagination. It is the SHA1 hash of the first file on the next page.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Optional parameter that allows choosing the response format. Supported values are `xml` and `json`. If the parameter is not provided in the request, the response will be returned in `xml` (default).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: the maximum number of file SHA1 hashes to return. This value has to be an integer in the range from 1 and 1000 (1000 is the default value)

parameters.name: extended
parameters.description: extended is an optional parameter. Possible values are true - extended, and false - non-extended data set (default)

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description: if this parameter is provided in the request, the query will return a filtered list of files that match the requested classification. Possible values are: - KNOWN - SUSPICIOUS - MALICIOUS - UNKNOWN

400.description: Bad Request! The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. A possible reason might be that the request contains Unicode characters that cannot be processed.

401.description: Unauthorized! The request requires user authentication. The request MUST include a WWW- Authenticate header field containing a challenge applicable to the requested resource.

403.description: Forbidden! The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

post.description: This service enables the submission of a URL for analysis.  ReversingLabs will crawl the URL, identifying files to download and submitting them to our file processing pipeline for classification and enrichment.  A detailed report can then be retrieved using our URL Threat Intelligence API.

parameters.name: post_format
parameters.description: Required parameter that defines the POST payload format. Supported options are xml and json

parameters.name: Content-Type:
parameters.description: Content type

get.summary: Get Files Signed with Specific Certificate Thumbprint(s)
get.description: This service provides a list of files signed with a particular certificate, specified by its thumbprint.

parameters.name: thumbprint
parameters.description: the thumbprint (sha1, sha256, md5) of the requested certificate. Most of our certificates use SHA256 for storing the thumbprint

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description: if this parameter is provided in the request, the query will return a list of only those files that match the requested threat status. Possible values are: KNOWN, MALICIOUS, SUSPICIOUS, UNKNOWN

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Optional parameter that allows choosing the response format. Supported values are `xml` and `json`. If the parameter is not provided in the request, the response will be returned in `xml` (default).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return in the certificate file list. It is possible to choose a number between 1 and 100 (100 is the default value)

parameters.name: extended
parameters.description: Both single and bulk malware presence queries support an additional query flag extended which can be either true or false. If not specified, the default value is false. When set to true, the extended flag will direct databrowser to provide a richer response schema with additional information about the requested file(s).
